title: Improve UI typography and reorganize the Farmer form into MGO/ST, Farmer, and Crop sections

requirements.text: Apply a more attractive, consistent visual theme across the app (LoginPage, Header, FarmerForm, SettingsDialog) by improving typography (font family, heading hierarchy, spacing) and refining component styling while staying within the existing Tailwind + shadcn/ui patterns (no new product features).

quotes: Can we use more attractive user interface and design elements such as font,

acceptanceCriteria: A new, coherent visual theme is applied consistently across main screens (login + main app).
Typography is noticeably improved: clearer heading sizes/weights, consistent label/body text sizing, and a modern font family applied globally.
No user-facing text is changed from non-English to non-English; keep all user-facing text in English.
No changes require backend updates; the app remains functional and form submission behavior is unchanged.

requirements.text: Reorganize the FarmerForm UI into clearly separated sections: (1) MGO/ST info, (2) Farmer info, and (3) Crop info. Each section must have a visible section title and grouped fields, without changing existing validation rules or submission payload content.

quotes: also can we Divide MGO info ST etc in one section Farmer info in other and crop info in other

acceptanceCriteria: The form renders three distinct, labeled sections: MGO/ST, Farmer, and Crop.
MGO/ST section contains: ST, MGO Headquarters (and keeps the existing dependency behavior: MGO Headquarters disabled until ST is selected).
Farmer section contains: Farmer Name, Mobile Number, Village, District, Taluka (and preserves districtâ†’taluka dependency behavior).
Crop section contains: Wheat Variety, Crop 1, Crop 2, Irrigation Type, Total Acreage.
Login ID remains read-only and visible (placement can be above sections), and the submit button still submits the same data successfully.
All existing validations and error messages still trigger appropriately for their fields.

requirements.text: Improve the FarmerForm layout responsiveness by using a structured layout (e.g., stacked on mobile, multi-column grid on larger screens) within each section to reduce vertical scrolling while keeping the current shadcn/ui components (Card, Input, Button, SearchableSelect) intact.
acceptanceCriteria: On small screens, fields remain easy to read and interact with (no cramped multi-column layout).
On larger screens, related fields are arranged to reduce excessive vertical whitespace (e.g., District/Taluka side-by-side where appropriate).
No input, select, or button becomes inaccessible or visually clipped at common breakpoints (mobile, tablet, desktop).

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Do not edit immutable frontend hook files: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx.
Keep the backend as-is (single-actor Motoko); no schema/state migrations are required for UI-only changes.
Do not change the Google Apps Script URL locking behavior or any existing submission payload behavior.
nonGoals: Adding new backend endpoints or changing backend authorization/profile logic.
Adding new data fields to the farmer submission payload or changing the Google Sheets column/order semantics.
